REQ-RES-001.title: Five Resource Types
REQ-RES-001.notes: Foundational spec - defines Credits, Food, Ore, Petroleum, Research Points. No dependencies.

REQ-RES-002.title: Sector Production Rates

blockers.reason: Requires sector type definitions (Food, Ore, Petroleum, Commerce, Urban, Education, Government, Research sectors)
Production formula includes civil status multiplier; can implement with 1.0× multiplier initially

REQ-RES-002.notes: Defines base production rates per sector type. Critical dependency on SECTOR system for sector type enumeration.

REQ-RES-003.title: Civil Status Income Multiplier

blockers.reason: Multiplier values depend on civil status levels from calculation formula; can hardcode statuses initially

REQ-RES-003.notes: Defines 2.5× (Ecstatic) to 0.25× (Rioting) multipliers. Can be implemented independently with hardcoded civil status values.

REQ-RES-004.title: Population Food Consumption
REQ-RES-004.notes: Formula: Population × 0.5 food/capita/turn. Simple calculation, no hard blockers.

REQ-RES-005.title: Military Maintenance Costs

blockers.reason: Requires military unit definitions with ore/petroleum build costs to calculate 5%/3% maintenance
Requires unit roster tracking to sum maintenance costs across all units

REQ-RES-005.notes: Maintenance formula: Σ(Unit Ore Cost × 5%) + Σ(Unit Petroleum Cost × 3%). Cannot implement without unit cost data.

REQ-RES-006.title: Population Growth and Decline

blockers.reason: Growth rate depends on food availability calculation; can implement with fixed population initially

REQ-RES-006.notes: Formula: +2% growth (surplus) or -10% decline (deficit). Can be implemented standalone with food consumption dependency.

REQ-RES-007.title: Civil Status Calculation Formula

blockers.reason: Food security modifier requires food consumption calculation; can use simplified formula initially
Battle outcome modifier requires combat results tracking; can skip battle modifier initially
Territory growth modifier requires sector gain/loss tracking; can skip territory modifier initially
Overcrowding penalty requires urban capacity calculation; can skip overcrowding check initially

REQ-RES-007.notes: Complex formula with 5 factors. All blockers are SOFT - can implement incrementally starting with food security only.

REQ-RES-008.title: Resource Storage and Negative Balances
REQ-RES-008.notes: Defines no hard caps, negative balance consequences. Can be implemented standalone once resource types exist.

REQ-RES-009.title: Sector Type Conversion

blockers.reason: Requires sector database and type definitions to perform conversion
Cannot convert Urban sectors restriction depends on Urban capacity mechanics; can hardcode restriction

REQ-RES-009.notes: Conversion cost = 50% of target sector cost. Requires sector management system.

REQ-RES-010.title: Urban Sectors and Population Capacity

blockers.reason: Requires Urban sector type definition and sector counting capability

REQ-RES-010.notes: Formula: Capacity = Urban Sectors × 10,000. Simple once sector system exists.

REQ-RES-011.title: Research Point Accumulation

blockers.reason: Tier unlock thresholds depend on research tech tree structure; can accumulate points without unlocks

REQ-RES-011.notes: Formula: (Research Sectors × 100 RP) × Civil Status Multiplier. Accumulation can work independently of tech tree.

REQ-RES-012.title: Economic Victory Condition

blockers.reason: Requires victory checking framework and victory condition registration
Networth calculation uses market prices; can use fixed prices initially
Networth includes military unit values; can skip military from networth initially
Networth includes sector values (× 8,000); can use sector count approximation

REQ-RES-012.notes: Victory condition: Player Networth ≥ 1.5 × 2nd Place Networth. Complex networth calculation with many components.
